comment: A set of outer measure zero is measurable. The term "outer measure zero" here is slightly different from "nullset/negligible set"; a nullset has ` vol* ( A ) = 0 ` while "outer measure zero" means that for any ` x ` there is a ` y ` containing ` A ` with volume less than ` x ` . Assuming AC, these notions are equivalent (because the intersection of all such ` y ` is a nullset) but in ZF this is a strictly weaker notion. Proposition 563Gb of [Fremlin5] p. 193. (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 19-Mar-2015.)
